III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
There were no violations identified in the renewal evaluation completed 4/11/2023.
No corrective action was required. The identification of barriers for compliance
were not needed.
2

Financial Overview
Not applicable.
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in both entrance and exit conferences. Staff
interviews were positive and indicated the staff is adequately supported by the
agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: The family has a pool in the back yard without door alarms.
Resolution: Door alarms for the front and back doors were installed and picture
documentation/confirmation was provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
